Package org.deidentifier.flash

This package provides the public API for the FLASH anonymization framework.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
FLASHConfiguration  
FLASHListener This class implements a listener for the FLASH framework
FLASHResult Encapsulates the results of an execution of the FLASH algorithm
 

Class Summary
AttributeType Represents an attribute type
AttributeType.Hierarchy This class implements a generalization hierarchy
AttributeType.Hierarchy.DefaultHierarchy The default implementation of a generalization hierarchy.
Data Represents input data for the flash framework
Data.DefaultData The default implementation of a data object.
DataDefinition Encapsulates a definition of the types of attributes contained in a dataset
DataHandle This class provides access to dictionary encoded data.
DataHandleOutput An implementation of the class DataHandle and the FLASHResult interface for output data.
DataType This class provides access to the data types supported by the FLASH framework
FLASHAdapter This class implements a listener for the FLASH framework
FLASHAnonymizer This class offers several methods to define parameters and execute the FLASH algorithm.
FLASHLattice This class implements a representation of the generalization lattice that is exposed to users of the API

Package org.deidentifier.flash Description

This package provides the public API for the FLASH anonymization framework.

  • The class AttributeType encapsulates the four different kinds of attributes recognized by the framework.
  • The class DataType encapsulates the three different kinds of data types recognized by the framework.
  • The class Data represents an input dataset for the algorithm.
  • The class DataDefinitio, an instance of which can be obtain for any input data by calling Data.getDefinition(), allows assign attribute types, data types and further parameters to a dataset.
  • The class DataHandle, an instance of which can be obtain for any input data by calling Data.getHandle() and for any output data by calling FLASHResult.getHandle(), implements convenience methods for accessing a dictionary encoded representation of a dataset. It also allows manipulating the data (e.g., sorting it) and makes sure that input and output data are always in sync.
  • The class FLASHAnonymizer represents the actual algorithm and allows to derive anonymous representations of the input dataset, e.g., by calling FLASHAnonymizer.kAnonymize() or FLASHAnonymizer.lDiversify().
  • The class FLASHResult represents the results of executing the algorithm. It provides access to the globally optimal solution and the underlying generalization lattice FLASHLattice.
  • The class FLASHAdapter can be utilized to attach a listener to the FLASH framework, tracking its progress while anonymizing a dataset.
